summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 discussing the logistics of transferring digital evidence (hard drives and thumb drives) related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case for upload to the Relativity review platform. The emails coordinate the shipment of materials containing data from specific devices (identified by NYC evidence numbers), confirm receipt of supplemental files, and inquire about outstanding items and data recovery issues.

events.title: Evidence Transfer Coordination
events.description: Email follow-up to confirm shipment of a hard drive containing evidence materials for the Maxwell case for upload to Relativity.

events.title: Thumb Drive Shipment Arranged
events.description: Email arranging to mail a thumb drive containing folders for five specific evidence devices (NYCO24332, NYCO24369, NYCO24369_1, NYCO24372, NYCO24384) for processing and upload.

events.title: Evidence Status Updates and Queries
events.description: Series of emails discussing the status of evidence processing, confirming receipt of supplemental materials, identifying missing items (NYC027913), and noting devices requiring hardware recovery due to physical failure.

keyFacts: The emails detail the transfer of digital evidence from multiple devices (identified by NYC evidence numbers like NYCO24332) for the Ghislaine Maxwell case to be uploaded to the Relativity platform.
There is a specific mention of approximately 71,000 zero-byte (empty) files found in the initial seven devices provided, which is noted as a common occurrence in data recovery software.

Several devices (e.g., NYC024376 through 380, drives in NYC024395) are noted as still being processed, with some requiring hardware recovery due to physical drive failures, indicating a complex data extraction process.
The correspondence highlights meticulous tracking and verification of evidence items, with spreadsheets used to confirm which devices have been provided and which are outstanding.
